intro: Ruellia chinensis, commonly known as Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of trumpet-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Ruellia chinensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
